chunks.text:
inngest/function.failed
The
```
inngest/function.failed
```
event is sent whenever any single function fails in your
[Inngest environment](\docs\platform\environments)
.
This event can be used to track all function failures in a single place, enabling you to send metrics, alerts, or events to
[external systems like Datadog or Sentry](\docs\examples\track-failures-in-datadog)
for all of your Inngest functions.
Our SDKs offer shorthand
["on failure"](\docs\reference\system-events\inngest-function-failed#related-resources)
handler options that can be used to handle this event for a specific function.

inngest/function.failed
The event payload
- Name `name` Type string: "inngest/function.failed" Description The `inngest/` event prefix is reserved for system events in each environment.
- Name `data` Type object Description The event payload data. Properties
- Name `ts` Type number Description The timestamp integer in milliseconds at which the failure occurred.

inngest/function.failed
Related resources
- [TypeScript SDK: onFailure handler](\docs\reference\functions\handling-failures)
- [Python SDK: on](\docs\reference\python\functions\create#on_failure)
[_](\docs\reference\python\functions\create#on_failure)
[failure handler](\docs\reference\python\functions\create#on_failure)
- [Example: Track all function failures in Datadog](\docs\examples\track-failures-in-datadog)
